task_summary: Navigate a robot arm to reach the scissors while avoiding obstacles.

task_long_description.overview: A robot arm in an office tabletop environment must reach the scissors on the right, located atop a yellow book. The robot must avoid or navigate around nearby objects such as books and a cup while approaching the scissors. Successful task execution is characterized by robust perception of the scissors, accurate approach above the object, and final alignment for interaction. Proper obstacle avoidance ensures no undesired contact with surrounding objects.
preconditions: Scissors are present and visible in the workspace
Robot is operational and starts in a collision-free pose
No objects block direct line-of-sight to scissors
stepwise_plan: Verify the visibility of the scissors or detect them if unseen
Move the end-effector above the scissors avoiding obstacles
Approach and align with the scissors for further manipulation
success_criteria: End-effector is accurately aligned above the scissors with no collisions
No contact with obstacles during the approach
Verification of scissors location is performed
failure_and_recovery: Failure to detect scissors: perform redetection procedure
Obstacle encountered while moving: halt and plan alternate trajectory
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the end-effector is stably aligned above the scissors or if repeated failure to reach the target occurs

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: avoid obstacle and reach the scissors

node_specs.description: Checks if the scissors are visible
Moves end-effector above the scissors with obstacle avoidance
Approaches and aligns finely above the scissors

failure_modes: Collision with an obstacle during approach
recovery_strategy: Pause on obstacle contact and replan path if possible
assumptions: Frames [0-8] show a robot arm approaching scissors on a cluttered tabletop; no explicit pushing or grasping is visible, only approach and align.
No direct evidence of actual graspâ€”BT terminates at alignment to match frames.
Instruction implies obstacle avoidance, which relies on trajectory selection (implicit in 'MoveAbove').

expected_success_criteria: Scissors are located and uniquely identified
End-effector is positioned above and aligned to the scissors
No collision detected with adjacent objects
